summary: The Food Eligibility for Education and Development Act of 2025 (FEED Act of 2025) amends the Food and Nutrition Act of 2008. It excludes certain income of students under 21 from eligibility determinations for food assistance programs. Specifically, it excludes income from apprenticeships, internships, or work-based learning programs that are components of career and technical education programs, if the student lives with a parent or is under the parental control of a household member. The Secretary of Agriculture will establish procedures to verify eligibility requirements.
